heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 13 October 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 2624 lux), dew point temperature (down 1.6°C), feels like temperature (down 1.6°C), and cloud levels (up 121 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 24.0m lower than yesterday, 178.6m higher than the past week, 120.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1116m to a maximum of 2360m, averaging 1470.8m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1292.2m and 1591.6m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and a mix of sun and clouds. Similar weather conditions should remain.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
